name: Global Venture Congress
overview:
Global Venture Congress (GVC) is one of the most prestigious, high-profile international venture conference in the world. It is a 2-day conference, held twice annually in Madison Square Garden, New York, one in Biotech and Life Sciences and the second in Technology.

The conference is designed to explore the frontiers of biotech & life sciences and Technology, address the venture capital landscape, identify current trends in innovation, learn scientific and technology discoveries and discover cutting-edge Life Sciences and Technology companies.

More than 50 speakers in each conference are carefully chosen, world renowned visionaries, high-profile active investors in Life Sciences and Technology companies, founders/C-level executives of cutting edge companies and renowned thought leaders, movers and shakers of the industry and analysts. Previous key note speakers were Nobel Laureate James Watson, Nobel Laureate Ferid Murad, and Nobel Peace Prize winner Dr. Eric Chivian. The venture capitalist speakers have been the whoâ€™s-who of the industry.

The Innovator Showcase program is a presentation by a chosen few emerging Biotech & Life Sciences and Technology companies both private and public with “imminent funding” potential. The screening process is extremely rigorous and only companies which are currently fundable are selected for participation. More than $200M in funding have been secured in the past during this program.

Exhibitors at the conference are a chosen few: companies with cutting edge technologies, Biotech & Life Sciences, Technology products and services, international agencies, high profile strategic partners and other service providers.

Delegates in this conference have been from including countries such as UK, Germany, Israel, Finland, Scotland, Canada, China, South Korea, India, and the USA.
